verses.verse: My son, <S%H1121><s%> give <S%H7181><s%> attention <S%H7181><s%> to my wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> Incline <S%H5186><s%> your ear <S%H241><s%> to my understanding; <S%H8394><s%>
That you may observe <S%H8104><s%> discretion, <S%H4209><s%> And your lips <S%H8193><s%> may reserve <S%H5341><s%> knowledge. <S%H1847><s%>
For the lips <S%H8193><s%> of an adulteress <S%H2114><s%> drip <S%H5197><s%> honey, <S%H5317><s%> And smoother <S%H2509><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> oil <S%H8081><s%> is her speech; <S%H2441><s%>
But in the end <S%H319><s%> she is bitter <S%H4751><s%> as wormwood, <S%H3939><s%> Sharp <S%H2299><s%> as a two-edged sword. <S%H2719><s%>
Her feet <S%H7272><s%> go <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to death, <S%H4194><s%> Her steps <S%H6806><s%> lay <S%H8551><s%> hold <S%H8551><s%> of Sheol. <S%H7585><s%>
She does not ponder <S%H6424><s%> the path <S%H734><s%> of life; <S%H9132><s%> Her ways <S%H4570><s%> are unstable, <S%H5128><s%> she does not know <S%H3045><s%> [it].
Now <S%H6258><s%> then, [my] sons, <S%H1121><s%> listen <S%H8085><s%> to me, And do not depart <S%H5493><s%> from the words <S%H561><s%> of my mouth. <S%H6310><s%>
Keep <S%H7368><s%> your way <S%H1870><s%> far <S%H7368><s%> from her, And do not go <S%H7126><s%> near <S%H7126><s%> the door <S%H6607><s%> of her house, <S%H1004><s%>
Lest <S%H6435><s%> you give <S%H5414><s%> your vigor <S%H1935><s%> to others, <S%H312><s%> And your years <S%H8141><s%> to the cruel <S%H394><s%> one; <S%H394><s%>

Lest <S%H6435><s%> strangers <S%H2114><s%> be filled <S%H7646><s%> with your strength, <S%H3581><s%> And your hard-earned goods <S%H6089><s%> [go] to the house <S%H1004><s%> of an alien; <S%H5237><s%>
And you groan <S%H5098><s%> at your latter <S%H319><s%> end, <S%H319><s%> When your flesh <S%H1320><s%> and your body <S%H7607><s%> are consumed; <S%H3615><s%>
And you say, <S%H559><s%> "How <S%H349><s%> I have hated <S%H8130><s%> instruction! <S%H4148><s%> And my heart <S%H3820><s%> spurned <S%H5006><s%> reproof! <S%H9640><s%>
"And I have not listened <S%H8085><s%> to the voice <S%H6963><s%> of my teachers, <S%H4175><s%> Nor <S%H3808><s%> inclined <S%H5186><s%> my ear <S%H241><s%> to my instructors! <S%H3925><s%>
"I was almost <S%H4592><s%> in utter <S%H3605><s%> ruin <S%H9563><s%> In the midst <S%H8432><s%> of the assembly <S%H6951><s%> and congregation. <S%H5712><s%>"
Drink <S%H8354><s%> water <S%H4325><s%> from your own cistern, <S%H953><s%> And fresh <S%H5140><s%> water <S%H5140><s%> from your own well. <S%H875><s%>
Should your springs <S%H4599><s%> be dispersed <S%H6327><s%> abroad, <S%H2351><s%> Streams <S%H6388><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%> in the streets <S%H7339><s%>?
Let them be yours alone, <S%H905><s%> And not for strangers <S%H2114><s%> with you.
Let your fountain <S%H4726><s%> be blessed, <S%H1288><s%> And rejoice <S%H8055><s%> in the wife <S%H802><s%> of your youth. <S%H5271><s%>

[As] a loving <S%H158><s%> hind <S%H355><s%> and a graceful <S%H2580><s%> doe, <S%H3280><s%> Let her breasts <S%H1717><s%> satisfy <S%H7301><s%> you at all <S%H3605><s%> times; <S%H6256><s%> Be exhilarated <S%H7686><s%> always <S%H8548><s%> with her love. <S%H160><s%>
For why <S%H4100><s%> should you, my son, <S%H1121><s%> be exhilarated <S%H7686><s%> with an adulteress, <S%H2114><s%> And embrace <S%H2263><s%> the bosom <S%H2436><s%> of a foreigner <S%H5237><s%>?
For the ways <S%H1870><s%> of a man <S%H376><s%> are before <S%H5227><s%> the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> And He watches <S%H6424><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> his paths. <S%H4570><s%>
His own iniquities <S%H5771><s%> will capture <S%H3920><s%> the wicked, <S%H7563><s%> And he will be held <S%H8551><s%> with the cords <S%H9112><s%> of his sin. <S%H9128><s%>
He will die <S%H4191><s%> for lack <S%H369><s%> of instruction, <S%H4148><s%> And in the greatness <S%H7230><s%> of his folly <S%H200><s%> he will go <S%H7686><s%> astray. <S%H7686><s%>
